definition: to send to/to deliver to/to give sb a lift (e.g. in a car)
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: They demanded that arrangements be made to send their grandma to the hospice.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求做好安排将他们的祖母送去宁养院。

sentences.english: My idea is we (should) make arrangements to send grandma to the hospice.
sentences.chinese: 我的意见是我们来做安排把祖母送去宁养院。

definition: to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
to express sympathy, greetings, consolation etc
to send/to give as a present
to visit/to pay a call to
to pass on to sb/to carry and give to sb else
to visit/to call on sb/to look around
